SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Default
SpellsAndCharms.description: Basic attack than can be pressed rapidly for combo strikes
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Casts reduce cooldowns of other spells, Airborne impacts contribute to Ancient Magic meter

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - The Path to Hogwarts
SpellsAndCharms.description: Press left on the d-pad to reveal interactibles.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - The Path to Hogwarts
SpellsAndCharms.description: Flashlight.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - The Path to Hogwarts
SpellsAndCharms.description: Press the Counter button once to block an incoming attack (Protego), hold it to activate a stunning spell (Stupefy).
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Various buffs including increased meter gain, the ability to curse enemies, and perfect counters can break enemy shields.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - Defence Against the Dark Arts Class
SpellsAndCharms.description: Lifts enemies and objects into the air.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Also lifts enemies around target into air.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - Charms Class
SpellsAndCharms.description: Yanks most enemies to you, and pulls them airborne. Used in exploration to grab collectibles.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Also pulls enemies around target to you.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Assignment Side Quest - Professor Ronen’s Assignment
SpellsAndCharms.description: Rebuild damaged objects. Can rebuild throwables after throwing them.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - Welcome to Hogsmeade
SpellsAndCharms.description: Throws objects mid-combat. Does high damage and can break shield charms, no matter the color.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Can catch and throw disarmed enemy weapons.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - Welcome to Hogsmeade
SpellsAndCharms.description: Uses a stock of meter for a highly damaging attack. Breaks shield charms and often incapacitates instantly.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Can contribute more to Ancient Magic meter with various spell talents

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Assignment Side Quest - Professor Hecat’s Assignment 2
SpellsAndCharms.description: Long-range attack. Disarms most enemies and damages them.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Assignment Side Quest - Professor Hecat’s Assignment 1
SpellsAndCharms.description: Short-range flamethrower.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Turns Incendio into a circle AOE around player.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Assignment Side Quest - Professor Sharp’s Assignment 1
SpellsAndCharms.description: Throws enemies and objects. Does no damage on it's own, but enemies and objects can be thrown into surfaces or other enemies.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Releases additional blast in AOE around player.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - Secrets of the Restricted Section
SpellsAndCharms.description: Makes you mostly invisible, enters stealth mode.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - The Room of Requirement
SpellsAndCharms.description: Vanishes Room of Requirement item, refunds into Moonstone

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - The Room of Requirement
SpellsAndCharms.description: Conjures Room of Requirement Items

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - The Room of Requirement
SpellsAndCharms.description: Alters the form and features of Room of Requirement items

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - In the Shadow of the Undercroft
SpellsAndCharms.description: Long-range fireball. Sets enemy on fire.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Impacts create bolts of fire that seek out enemies.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - Percival Rackham's Trial
SpellsAndCharms.description: This spell petrifies the target's body during stealth. Instantly incapacitates most enemies, but stronger ones can break out after a time.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Assignment Side Quest - Professor Sharp’s Assignment 2
SpellsAndCharms.description: Longe-range attack. Deals considerable damage.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Slices through target to hit enemies behind them.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Assignment Side Quest - Professor Garlick’s Assignment 1
SpellsAndCharms.description: A spell that lifts small objects or animals in the air. While this spell does not work on humans, it can make them levitate a few feets up in the air if the spell is cast upon a target's clothes.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - The Caretaker’s Lunar Lament
SpellsAndCharms.description: Unlocks doors. There are various levels you have to unlock by collecting Demiguise Moons.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: None (Unlock Level upgraded by returning Demiguise Moons to Mr. Moon.)

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Assignment Side Quest - Madam Kogawa’s Assignment 1
SpellsAndCharms.description: Freezes enemies, increases damage of subsequent attacks.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Creates damaging ice shards when striking frozen enemy.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Assignment Side Quest - Professor Onai’s Assignment
SpellsAndCharms.description: Slams enemies into the ground. Does more damage if they're airborne.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Creates shockwave around target's impact point.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - Beasts Class
SpellsAndCharms.description: For taking care of beasts.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - Beasts Class
SpellsAndCharms.description: For taking care of beasts.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Main Quest - The Elf, the Nab-Sack, and the Loom
SpellsAndCharms.description: Captures beasts.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Assignment Side Quest - Professor Howin's Assignment
SpellsAndCharms.description: Deals heavy damage and hits surrounding enemies.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Assignment Side Quest - Professor Garlick’s Assignment 2
SpellsAndCharms.description: Flips enemies and objects. Your fastest cooldown spell to get the enemy airborne.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Assignment Side Quest - Madam Kogawa’s Assignment 2
SpellsAndCharms.description: Slows objects and enemies. Sends enemies airborne.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Assignment Side Quest - Professor Weasley's Assignment
SpellsAndCharms.description: Transforms objects and enemies into alternate forms.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Companion Quest - Sebastian Sallow's In the Shadow of the Study
SpellsAndCharms.description: Inflicts damage over time and curses enemies.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Striking cursed enemy creates cursing projectile.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Companion Quest - Sebastian Sallow's In the Shadow of Time
SpellsAndCharms.description: Charms and curses enemies.
SpellsAndCharms.upgrades: Charmed enemies spread Curse through their attacks.

SpellsAndCharms.unlock: Companion Quest - Sebastian Sallow's In the Shadow of the Relic
SpellsAndCharms.description: Kills enemies instantly.

Potions.description: Aids in healing and restores a bit of the drinker's health
This potion transforms whoever drinks it into a stone-like version of themselves. Presumably, this will protect the wizard who drank the potion from upcoming damage during battles.
Reduces the drinker's spell cooldown time.
Potions.unlock: Purchase this recipe at J. Pippins Potions - 800G
Potions.ingredients:
1x Lacewing Flies 
1x Fluxweed Stem 
1x Dugbog Tongue

Potions.description: Increases the drinker's spell damage for a limited time.
Potions.unlock: Purchase this recipe at J. Pippins Potions - 800G

Potions.description: This potion is used to make whoever drinks it invisible for 1 minute
Potions.unlock: Purchase this recipe at J. Pippins Potions - 500G
Potions.ingredients:
1x Leaping Toadstool Caps 
1x Knotgrass Sprig 
1x Troll Bogeys

Potions.description: Creates a storm around the drinker which will stun and damage nearby enemies.
Potions.unlock: Purchase this recipe at J. Pippins Potions - 1200G
Potions.ingredients:
1x Leech Juice 
1x Shrivelfig Fruit 
1x Stench of the Dead

Beasts.description: Puffskeins are round and fluffy beasts, soft enough to cuddle but tough enough to be thrown around. Puffskeins will eat almost anything, but their favorite meal is bogies. They are common household pets for wizarding families because they are easy to maintain.
Beasts.find-it: These little creatures can be found in the Forbidden Forest and the South Hogwarts Region.

Beasts.description: A Fwooper is a colorful bird that has a song known to drive people made.
Beasts.find-it: They can be found in the South Hogwarts Region.

Beasts.description: A Jobberknoll is a small speckled bluebird, which never makes any noise until the moment of its death.
Beasts.find-it: They can be found in the Forbidden Forest.

Beasts.description: Graphorns are large mountain-dwelling beasts that have a tough hide and two sharp horns. The tentacle-like appendages on Graphorns’ faces are used for capturing food and tending to their young. Graphorns are known for their aggressive nature; however, a witch of wizard has been known to befriend one in rare circumstances.
Beasts.find-it: They can be found out in the wild in Clagmar Coast or can be caught during the main quest San Bakar's Trial.

Beasts.description: The Mooncalf is a small, calf-like beast with enormous eyes and a shy personality. They can be observed dancing when the light of the full moon hits the ground.
Beasts.find-it: Mooncalves can be found in the Forbidden Forest and the South Hogwarts Region. Keep in mind that these beats can only be seen and caught during the night.

Beasts.description: The Niffler is a small, furry and mischievous beast that causes mayhem in its pursuit of shiny objects which it stores in its marsupial-like pouch.
Beasts.find-it: They can be found in Hogwarts Valley.

Beasts.description: A large magical toad with warts that are useful in potion making.
Beasts.find-it: You can find a den of these toads south of the map next to Aranshire and in the Forbidden Forest.

Beasts.description: The Thestral is a haunted, winged equine beast that is only visible to those who have seen death.
Beasts.find-it: You can find a den of these toads south of the map next to Aranshire and in the Forbidden Forest.

Beasts.description: The Hippogriff is a majestic beast with the front half of an eagle and the back half of a horse. The Hippogriff can soar great distances and commands the respect of anyone who dares to approach it.
Beasts.find-it: They can be found in the Forbidden Forest or in The High Keep main quest.

Beasts.description: Kneazles are cat-like beasts that have large ears and a plumed tail. They can be aggressive, but if they like a witch or wizard, they make exceptional pets. Kneazles are highly intelligent and have an ability to detect suspicious or distrustful people.
Beasts.find-it: They can be found in the South Sea Bog.

Beasts.description: Diricawls are plump, fluffy birds incapable of flight. They have the unique ability to vanish and reappear to escape danger. Muggles were aware of these birds at one time and called them Dodos. However, Muggles now believe them to be extinct.
Beasts.find-it: Diricawls can be found in the South Hogwarts Region.

Beasts.description: The phoenix is an elegant, rare bird that possesses powerful magic. It is reborn from its ashes after bursting into flames. The loyalty of the phoenix is hard won.
Beasts.find-it: If you want to catch your first Phoenix, then you’ll need the Phoenix Rising quest. Phoenix Rising is another beast-related quest that’ll be given to you by Deek in the Room of Requirement.

Enemies.name: Ailsa Travers
Enemies.description:
Considered to be particularly close friends with Victor Rookwood, Ailsa Travers is all too
good at her job as an Ashwinder. Travers has been one of Rookwood's most devoted followers from the beginning and helped Rookwood gain critical footing within Hogsmeade.

Enemies.name: Death's Shadow
Enemies.description: These agents of Death attack mercilessly but will fall quickly to the power of a particular wand.

Enemies.name: Stoneback Dugbog
Enemies.description: These camouflaged beasts will often blend in with the environment to avoid detection until their prey is close enough to attack. Revelio can help you find them when exploring their habitats! While recovering from their attack lunge, they are vulnerable to Force spells that will flip or force their bodies in various directions. When its mouth is wide open, Levioso can be used on its fleshy tongue to hoist it into the air.

Enemies.name: Great Spined Dugbog
Enemies.description: These camouflaged beasts will often blend in with the environment to avoid detection until their prey is close enough to attack. Revelio can help you find them when exploring their habitats! While recovering from their attack lunge, they are vulnerable to Force spells that will flip or force their bodies in various directions. When its mouth is wide open, Levioso can be used on its fleshy tongue to hoist it into the air.

Enemies.name: Cottongrass Dugbog
Enemies.description: Cottongrass Dugbog - These camouflaged beasts will often blend in with the environment to avoid detection until their pray is close enough to attack. Revelio can help you find them when exploring their habitats! While recovering from their attack lunge, they are vulnerable to Force spells that will flip or force their bodies in various directions. When its mouth is wide open, Levioso can be used on its fleshy tongue to hoist it into the air.

Enemies.name: Rampant Dugbog
Enemies.description: Unknown to the villagers who trapped it, this Dugbog had been corrupted with some type of magic.

Enemies.name: Gwendolyn Zhou
Enemies.description: Blackmailed in to compliance, Gwendolyn Zhou was a reluctant Ashwinder informant within the Ministry of Magic. After being found out and fired, Gwendolyn was forced to join Rookwood to protect and provide for her family.

Enemies.name: Tempeste Thorne
Enemies.description: Clinical and cruel, Tempeste Thorne was trapping and carving up beasts for profit long before she left Hogwarts. One of the first to join Rookwood's criminal empire, under her gaze the poachers have risen from scramblers to a sturdy operation.

Enemies.name: Iona Morgan
Enemies.description: After graduating Hogwarts, Iona Morgan was turned out by her emotionally abusive family. Looking to her old friends from school, she found a new family and home in the Poacher Pack.

Enemies.name: Silvanus Selwyn
Enemies.description: Born to a life of privilege but not born early enough to inherit it, Silvanus Selwyn was known for his expensive and extravagant lifestyle. It was said that he would do anything to destroy the good reputation of his distinguished family. Silvanus was the one who opened doors to influential people for Rookwood.

Enemies.name: Dunstan Trinity
Enemies.description: A proficient pickpocket, Dunstan has always enjoyed the art of thieving. In fact, it was his light-fingeredness that led him to a friendless existence at Hogwarts.

Enemies.name: Catrin Haggarty
Enemies.description: Estranged from her brother Pádraic, a local shopkeeper, Catrin Haggarty turned to a life of petty thievery and tricks years ago. It wasn't until recently that she abandoned small scams for a chance at a bigger fortune with the Ashwinders.

Enemies.name: Ashwinder Duellist
Enemies.description: Among the quicker of Rookwood’s agents, these witches will surprise their opponents with back-to-back attacks. Their powerful Reductor Curse cannot be blocked by Shield Charms, but interrupting that cast with a Severing Charm will spin them to the point of losing control and hitting one of their own gang.

Enemies.name: Ashwinder Scout
Enemies.description: These unscrupulous wizards have not mastered Shield Charms, so they are vulnerable to all sorts of attacks.

Enemies.name: Ashwinder Assassin
Enemies.description: Some of the most evil witches alive, these secretive members of Rookwood's organisation have spent years turning the peaceful dead into an army of their own Inferi.They can summon Inferi to do their bidding at a moment's notice, often surprising their foes as the animated corpses emerge. Best to prevent them from calling forth their Inferi at all, but if all else fails, fire will defeat the undead. Interrupting their Reductor Curse with a Banishing Charm will cause them to lose control of their spell cast and hit one of their own gang.

Enemies.name: Ashwinder Ranger
Enemies.description: These witches have mastered the Full Body-Bind Curse in order to capture and terrorise their victims. Since they prefer to avoid the heart of a battle, pulling them close with Accio is an effective way to disrupt their plans. A Stunning Spell is often enough to knock them totally unconscious, but cleverness and skill are required to successfully cast it at them.

Enemies.name: Ashwinder Soldier
Enemies.description: These wizards are skilled at deflecting simple attacks, so their Shield Charms must be broken first in order to defeat them. As they warm up their Expulso Curse, levitating them with Levioso will cause them to lose control of the spell and hit one of their own gang.

Enemies.name: Ashwinder Executioner
Enemies.description: These wizards have mastered the ability to create localised lightning bolts to strike down their opponents. Disarming them with Expelliarmus as they prepare to cast their lightning spell will cause them to lose control of the spell with self-destructive effects. Slowing down these wizards with Arresto Momentum while they are conjuring lightning will keep that lightning striking longer, providing an opportunity to launch enemies into that lightning with shocking results.

Enemies.name: Poacher Duellist
Enemies.description: Among the quicker agents of Rookwood, these witches will surprise their opponents with back-to-back attacks.Their powerful Reductor Curse cannot be blocked by Shield Charms, but interrupting that cast with a Severing Charm will spin them to the point of losing control and hitting one of their own gang.

Enemies.name: Poacher Tracker
Enemies.description: These unscrupulous wizards have not mastered Shield Charms, so they are vulnerable to all sorts of attacks. Watch out for their counterattacks; they can catch you off guard by casting spells as they recover from being knocked down.

Enemies.name: Poacher Animagus
Enemies.description: Some poachers in Rookwood’s organization have become Animagi who can transform into the same animal: a ravenous wolf. When in the Animagus form, they must be weakened and forced back into human form before they can be properly defeated. The Transformation spell, however, can catch them off guard and revert them in an instant. Interrupting their Reductor Cause with a Banishing Charm will cause them to lose control of their spell cast and hit one of their own gang.

Enemies.name: Poacher Executioner
Enemies.description: These wizards have mastered the ability to conjure huge columns of fire to incinerate threats, but it is as dangerous to their own gang as it is to their opponents. Disarming them with Expelliarmus as they prepare to cast their fire spell will cause them to lose control of the spell with self-destructive effects. Slowing down these wizards with Arresto Momentum while they are conjuring fire will keep that fire raging longer, providing an opportunity to launch enemies into it with devastating results.

Enemies.name: Poacher Ranger
Enemies.description: These witches have mastered the Levitation Spell as a means of catching the beasts that they hunt. They use it skilfully in duels and battles against anyone who tries to stop them. Since they prefer to avoid the heart of a battle, pulling them in close with Accio is an effective way to disrupt their plans. A Stunning Spell is often enough to knock them totally unconscious, but cleverness and skill are required to successfully cast it at them.

Enemies.name: Poacher Stalker
Enemies.description: These wizards are skilled at deflecting simple attacks, so their Shield Charms must be broken first in order to defeat them. As they warm up their Blasting Curse, freezing them with Glacius will have a devastating effect.

Enemies.name: Loyalist Assassin
Enemies.description: These Ranrok Loyalists have manipulated corrupted ancient magic to grant themselves unnatural speed. Their magical speed enables them to escape combos unless they are slowed down with Arresto Momentum first. These Ranrok Loyalists’ blade dash attacks will penetrate common Shield Charms, so opponents must dodge out of the way and counterattack.

Enemies.name: Loyalist Commander
Enemies.description: These goblins wield hammers with impressive skill, often attacking in rapid succession. While leaping, they are particularly vulnerable to being slammed with Descendo.They also use ancient magic blasts that smash their targets from afar.

Enemies.name: Loyalist Sentinel
Enemies.description: Masters of both offensive and defensive magic, these Ranrok Loyalists can go toe-to-toe with the most powerful witches and wizards. These Ranrok Loyalists can use corrupted ancient magic to increase the strength of all nearby goblins. While they are building up magic to imbue into their companions, Bombarda can disrupt and unleash it in a devastating eruption.

Enemies.name: Loyalist Warrior
Enemies.description: Though heavy goblin weaponry is quite dangerous, Expelliarmus will make quick work of anything they are holding in their hands, leaving them with only their weakest options.

Enemies.name: Loyalist Ranger
Enemies.description: These Ranrok Loyalists try to keep as far away from their targets as possible and use their crossbows to launch bolts imbued with Ancient Magic. While they are preparing to fire, their bolts can be snatched away and launched back with Ancient Magic Throw for a devastating attack.

Enemies.name: Inferius
Enemies.description: Though invulnerable to most types of damage, Inferi cannot abide warmth and light and are therefore susceptible to fire.After an Inferius has been burned, other damaging attacks will have full effect, providing a few more options to destroy these abominations. A burning Inferius's impending attack provides the perfect opportunity to capitalise on the explosive power of Bombarda.

Enemies.name: Pergit
Enemies.description: Pergit is a goblin rebel who fights under Ranrok's banner. He is notorious for his callousness towards everyone except those he truly fears or admires.

Enemies.name: Belgruff the Bludgeoner
Enemies.description: Now known for his militant approach to goblin rights, Belgruff the Bludgeoner was once a peaceful member of the goblin rights movement. It is said that the taste of power he got being around Ranrok convinced him to change his ways.

Enemies.name: Grodbik
Enemies.description: A young outspoken goblin, Grodbik rose through the ranks quickly and was a trusted guard of Ranrok's mines.

Enemies.name: Ogbert The Odd
Enemies.description: Ogbert the Odd joined Ranrok's Loyalists after a run-in with a security dragon at Gringotts. Some wonder if he provoked the dragon whilst others bemoan the cruelty of keeping dragons chained up under a bank.

Enemies.name: Bardolph Beaumont's Corpse
Enemies.description: The reanimated corpse that once was Bardolph Beaumont, brother to Upper Hogsfield's Claire Beaumont. Bardolph had gone missing after allegedly connecting with Rookwood's lot, breaking the hearts of the Beaumont family.

Enemies.name: Lord of the Manor
Enemies.description: An Inferius who was rich in life, though now the only indication of wealth is his clothing.

Enemies.name: The Absconder
Enemies.description: This beast is an aberration, as it is not native to this region. In its short time here, however, this Acromantula possibly mothered a number of other Acromantulas in the area.

Enemies.name: The Grim
Enemies.description: Thought to be an omen of death upon the villagers of Netherwyck, this black wolf was simply a wolf who had been enchanted with some kind of magic. It shared its den with a great white wolf and their kin.

Enemies.name: The White Wolf
Enemies.description: A ferocious beast with striking white fur.

Enemies.name: Acromantula
Enemies.description: Though not technically a spider, this beast appears and behaves like other magical arachnids. As it is incredibly aggressive, and its powerful attacks will break Shield Charms, targets should dodge away and strike quickly between attacks. Patience and perseverance just might lead to victory. As it rears up, ripping it downward will catch it off guard.

Enemies.name: Venomous Scurriour
Enemies.description: When these spiders begin to burrow, Flipendo will rip them out of the ground, dealing massive damage. Its venomous attacks will poison the target, dealing damage over time, but Wiggenweld Potion will stop the poison from dealing further damage, allowing you to heal.

Enemies.name: Venomous Ambusher
Enemies.description: These spiders try to keep as far away as possible and shoot webs to incapacitate their prey. While airborne, their unprotected bellies are exposed, making them vulnerable to follow-up damage.

Enemies.name: Venomous Shooter
Enemies.description: These spiders prefer to attack from a distance, spitting acidic venom. Striking it with a fire spell as it prepares to attack with acidic venom will ignite the spider. Its venomous attacks will poison the target, dealing damage over time, but Wiggenweld Potion will stop the poison from dealing further damage, allowing you to heal.

Enemies.name: Venomous Matriarch
Enemies.description:
This monstrosity rears up as it is about to strike its target with a powerful bite that breaks through Shield Charms. The most obvious defence is to dodge out of the way.
As it rears up, ripping it downward with Descendo will catch it off guard.

Enemies.name: Venomous Hatchling
Enemies.description: These deal light damage, but that can add up quickly when a swarm of them attack relentlessly. These are easily defeated by almost any attack and will even die when they strike a simple Shield Charm. Its venomous attacks will poison the target, dealing damage over time, but Wiggenweld Potion will stop the poison from dealing further damage, allowing you to heal.

Enemies.name: Thornback Scurriour
Enemies.description: All types of magic spiders are quite vulnerable to fire, especially at low health. Fire attacks will the spider while it is low on health, causing it to skitter about frantically before it dies. If it takes further damage before it dies, it will explode, hitting nearby targets. When these spiders begin to burrow, Filipendo will rip them out of the ground, dealing massive damage.

Enemies.name: Thornback Hatchling
Enemies.description: These deal light damage, but that can add up quickly when a swarm of them attack relentlessly. These are easily defeated by almost any attack and will even die when they strike a simple Shield Charm.

Enemies.name: Thornback Ambusher
Enemies.description: These spiders try to keep as far away as possible and shoot webs to incapacitate their prey. While they are airborne, their unprotected bellies are exposed, making them vulnerable to follow-up damage.

Enemies.name: Thornback Shooter
Enemies.description: These spiders prefer to attack from a distance, spitting acidic venom. Striking it with a fire spell as it prepares to attack with acidic venom will ignite the spider.

Enemies.name: Thornback Matriarch
Enemies.description: This monstrosity rears up as it is about to strike its target with a powerful bite that breaks through Shield Charms. The most obvious defence is to dodge out of the way. As it rears up, ripping it downward with Descendo will catch it off guard.

Enemies.name: Pensieve Guardian
Enemies.description: The ultimate test for those seeking the deepest secrets of Ancient Magic, these sentries can only be defeated through the same magic that powers them. As they summon Ancient Magic into a powerful orb attack, the orb can be exploded to neutralise and repurpose that magic for your own benefit.

Enemies.name: Pensieve Sentry
Enemies.description: Created to protect the secrets of Ancient Magic, these animated statues strike hard and fast but are vulnerable to a variety of magic. Disarming them is a useful technique, but the Ancient Magic that animates them will also form a new weapon to keep them fighting.

Enemies.name: Pensieve Sentinel
Enemies.description: Ancient Magic ensures that their weapon will always re-form in their hands after being thrown or disarmed, granting them the ability to attack from afar indefinitely.

Enemies.name: Pensieve Protector
Enemies.description: Use Expelliarmus to disarm these Sentinels as they are more vulnerable once their weapons leave their hands. Hitting a Pensieve Protector with a powerful attack after it has been disarmed will drop it to its knee, making it momentarily vulnerable to further attacks before it regains the strength to summon its weapon.

Enemies.name: Armoured Troll
Enemies.description: The troll’s forehand-backhand club swing pattern attacks will break through common Shield Charms. Dodging is the safest defence. Distance will not protect against an angry troll, as it will tear up chunks of earth and throw them at its targets.After the troll slams its club on the ground with both hands, flipping it upwards with Filipendo will have greater leverage than usual, sending the club into the troll’s face for a powerful blow. Hitting a troll with its own boulder will catch it off guard and make it more vulnerable to follow-up attacks.

Enemies.name: Fighter Troll
Enemies.description: Watch out for the Fighter Troll's forehand-backhand club swing pattern, as both attacks will break right through common Shield Charms. Dodging is the safest defence from such attacks.Distance will not keep one safe from an angry troll, as they will ferociously charge at their targets.After the troll slams its club on the ground, flipping it upward will have greater leverage than usual, sending the club into the troll's face for a powerful blow. Hitting a troll with its own boulder will catch it off guard and make it more vulnerable to follow-up attacks.

Enemies.name: Fortified Troll
Enemies.description:
The troll's forehand-backhand club swing pattern attacks will break through common Shield Charms. Dodging is the safest defence. Distance will not protect against an angry troll, as it will tear up chunks of earth and throw them at its targets.
After the troll slams its club on the ground with both hands, flipping it upward with Flipendo will have greater leverage than usual, sending the club into the troll's face for a powerful blow. Hitting a troll with its own boulder will catch it off guard and make it more vulnerable to follow-up attacks.

Enemies.name: Death's Troll
Enemies.description: These monstrosities are conjured by Death himself. Only the most powerful magic can overcome them.

Enemies.name: Forest Troll
Enemies.description: The troll's forehand-backhand club swing pattern attacks will break through common Shield Charms. Dodging is the safest defence. Distance will not protect against an angry troll, as it will tear up chunks of earth and throw them at its targets.After the troll slams its club on the ground with both hands, flipping it upward with Flipendo will have greater leverage than usual, sending the club into the troll's face for a powerful blow. Hitting a troll with its own boulder will catch it off guard and make it more vulnerable to follow-up attacks.

Enemies.name: Mountain Troll
Enemies.description: The troll's forehand-backhand club swing pattern attacks will break through common Shield Charms. Dodging is the safest defence. Distance will not protect against an angry troll, as it will tear up chunks of earth and throw them at its targets.After the troll slams its club on the ground with both hands, flipping it upward with Flipendo will have greater leverage than usual, sending the club into the troll's face for a powerful blow. Hitting a troll with its own boulder will catch it off guard and make it more vulnerable to follow-up attacks.

Enemies.name: River Troll
Enemies.description: Distance will not protect against an angry troll, as it will tear up chunks of earth and throw them at its targets.After the troll slams its club on the ground with both hands, flipping it upward with Flipendo will have greater leverage than usual, sending the club into the troll's face for a powerful blow. Hitting a troll with its own boulder will catch it off guard and make it more vulnerable to follow-up attacks.

Enemies.name: Dark Mongrel
Enemies.description: Keeping as much distance as possible from Dark Mongrels will make dealing with them relatively easy. If it gets close, its attack can be repelled with Shield Charms and then a counterattack with any mastered spell. As it begins to charge in from afar, blasting it backwards with Depulso is particularly effective.

Enemies.name: Death's Dark Mongrel
Enemies.description: These murderous beasts obey only Death, leading souls to him at every opportunity.

Enemies.name: The Riparian Troll
Enemies.description: Misunderstanding a common wizard gesture, this troll rampaged through a small hamlet east of Hogwarts.

Enemies.name: The Insatiable Spider
Enemies.description: A horrific, giant arachnid living underneath Mary Portman's cottage in Aranshire.

Enemies.name: Quagmire Troll
Enemies.description: An especially mean forest troll who seems to enjoy wandering boggy areas.

Enemies.name: Alexandra's Troll
Enemies.description: With a train tunnel as its cave, this troll is tempting fate. If not killed by those wishing to loot its horde of items, it is likely to be the victim of a passing steam engine.

WandHandles.description: A metal handle with stylish groves and marbled shell at its base.
An unconventional, twisted handle design in marbled lilac.
A carved, floral handle design in light wood with bronze, vined leaves.
An enchanting, regal handle in shades of black and alabaster.
A powerful, corkscrewed handle design in alternating light and dark brown.
A stone handle with a good weight to it, carved from striking red marble.
A Marvelous, twisting handle design in dark grey, topped with a silver owl.
A marvelous, twisting handle design in light grey, topped with a gold owl.
A fantastical, bold handle design in starry white marble and dark grey, topped with a model planet.
A stately, strong handle design in black marble and silver.
An unconventional, twisted handle design in grey and silver.
An enchanting, regal handle in shades of gold and aquamarine.
A robust wooden handle design with natural, swirling woodgrain.
An impressive, ringed handle design in violet.
A kingly, checkerboard handle design in light and dark blue, topped with a bronze crown.
A black and golden handle with a commanding point at its base.

Brooms.description: A smooth ride that cuts through the air like a potioneer slicing ingredients.

Brooms.cost: You'll have to complete the first three Pop Balloon Challenges under the Exploration tab. After that, you'll have to pop 15 more sets of Balloons (for a total of 32 sets) to finally get ahold of the most elusive ride in the game
Brooms.description: Fly among the stars with a broom that celebrates them.
The perfect broom for those with a fiery temperament.
This heirloom broom has been passed down for generations.
A broom enchanted to celebrate your particular Hogwarts house pride

Brooms.cost: Completing the Pop Balloons Challenge is the only way to obtain title
Brooms.description: Designed with aerodynamics in mind, this broom will make travel a breeze
Finely crafted from ash, this broom is built for stability.

Brooms.cost: Night Dancer Broom is a reward for when you complete the challenge 'Pop 2 sets of Balloons'
Brooms.description: A nimble broom with an impressive style
Designed by the famous broom-maker Leonard Jewkes, this broom is perfect for handling the competition.
An agile broom for the flyer who wants to look impressive when demonstrating their myriand skills.

Brooms.cost: Completing the Pop Balloons Challenge is the only way to obtain title.
Brooms.description: A broom that captures an untamed nature with a little spark.
A stylysh broom with a light touch - quite literally.
A comfortable and speedy broom with a unique woven design.

Companions.name: Natsai Onai
Companions.description: Natsai Onai was an African witch who attended Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry in the 19th century and was sorted into Gryffindor house. Her mother was a professor of Divination.
Companions.biography:
As an only child, she grew up in Matabeleland, Africa, with a tribe, wandering the Matobo Hills with her father who was a giraffe Animagus, and watching her mother use divination to help protect their tribe from less-than-friendly neighbours. Her father was killed protecting her by local bandits when she was nine years old. She and her mother later moved to Uganda where she attended Uagadou. During such time, she learned to be an Animagus, learning to transform into a gazelle. Just before her fourth year, she transferred to Hogwarts when her mother took up a role as professor of Divination. She had to learn how to use a wand at Hogwarts, as hardly anyone at Uagadou used one, and Natsai still found wandless magic to be more instinctive and convenient. 

During the 1890–1891 school year, she choose to take Ancient Runes as an elective class, although in fact her mother had elected it for her. 

On 2 September 1890, when the new fifth-year student arrived to Charms class, she invited them to sit beside her.

magical-abilities-and-skills.transfiguration: Transfiguration: Natsai became an Animagus at a young age, and was able to assume the form of a gazelle spontaneously. She could also perform the Boggart-Banishing Spell on a Boggart by transforming it into a cat.
magical-abilities-and-skills.charms: Charms: Natsai was able to perform the Summoning Charm quite effortlessly.
magical-abilities-and-skills.dueling: Duelling: Natsai was highly talented in duelling and was capable in taking multiple opponents such as her fellow students in the Crossed Wands Dueling Club as well as the subordinates of Victor Rookwood and Theophilus Harlow.
magical-abilities-and-skills.wandless-magic: Wandless magic: Natsai was able to perform wandless magic during her years at Uagadou.

Companions.name: Sebastian Sallow
Companions.description:
Sebastian Sallow was a Scottish wizard and a Slytherin student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry during the late 19th century. Born to two professors at the school who died when he was young, he and his sister, Anne, were raised by their uncle Solomon Sallow, an ex-Auror. When Anne was cursed by Victor Rookwood, she developed a seemingly incurable illness. He tried everything from Nurse Blainey to St Mungo's to no avail, and eventually became convinced that the Dark Arts was the last hope for her. 

From an early age, he had a mastery of the Unforgivable Curses, and considered other curses such as Confringo to be among his favourites. His quest to unravel the secrets of Dark Magic, justified by finding his sister's cure, eventually culminated in the murder of his uncle, possibly resulting in Sebastian's expulsion from Hogwarts and trial at the Ministry of Magic.
Companions.biography:
Sebastian was born in 1874 or 1875 alongside a twin sister, Anne. They were raised by two professors who ingrained a thirst for knowledge into them, but also a sense of optimism and open-mindedness, which Sebastian would later hope to emulate. Their parents died when they were young after a lamp in their cellar poisoned them with an undetectable toxin.They were taken in by their uncle Solomon Sallow who lived in a home in Feldcroft. 

When Sebastian and Anne's parents died, they were taken care of by their uncle, Solomon Sallow. Heading into their fourth year at Hogwarts, their house was raided by Ranrok and his followers, causing Anne to be harmed and cursed. The curse on Anne resulted in a severe and debilitating illness that left her in pain, which resulted in her being unable to return to Hogwarts.

magical-abilities-and-skills.dark arts: Dark Arts: Sebastian's earliest known awareness of the Dark Arts was when he was a child and learned that his uncle Solomon had cast an Unforgivable Curse during his time as an Auror. By the age of fifteen, he was capable of casting all three Unforgivable Curses himself, even though they required extraordinary willpower and a real desire to commit evil in order to cast. Sebastian's range of spells were notably offensive, favouring spells such as the Blasting Curse, and often jumping to the Unforgivable Curses by mere instinct. Even as a young wizard, he was addicted to dark spell books such as Slytherin's Spellbook, and enthralled by darker tomes such as Magick Moste Evile. Sebastian justified his interest in the Dark Arts by claiming it was to find a cure for his sister Anne; however, not only did Anne not wish to be cured in this way, but Sebastian also seemed to genuinely enjoy the Dark Arts regardless, finding it 'incredible' that he was able to possess Inferi in the catacombs of Feldcroft.
magical-abilities-and-skills.dueling: Duelling: The champion of the Crossed Wands Dueling Club and one of the most skilful duellists in Hogwarts, Sebastian was recognised by his fellow students as an accomplished and fearsome combatant.He was capable of personally duelling his uncle Solomon, an accomplished Auror as well as countless battle-hardened goblins.
magical-abilities-and-skills.charisma and manipulation: Sebastian was a highly charismatic and confident individual, which not only impressed his fellow students, but allowed him to sway and manipulate his closest friends as well. He was capable of convincing Ominis Gaunt to open Slytherin's Scriptorium, something that initially Ominis was heavily reluctant to do, by appealing to Ominis' desire to learn the truth about his missing aunt. When challenged on his use of the Dark Arts, he repeatedly promised both Ominis and his friend that whatever mission he was doing would be his last venture and then he would stop, before simply continuing to push the boundary further. Solomon Sallow was the only individual that Sebastian was unable to sway, which irritated him greatly.
magical-abilities-and-skills.love: Despite his many faults, Sebastian had an enormous devotion to his twin sister, Anne Sallow, to the point that he would willingly sacrifice his own code of morality to attempt to save her. For two years, he gave his full attention to restoring Anne's health, refusing to accept his uncle's claims that she could not be saved.

Companions.name: Ominis Gaunt
Companions.description: Ominis Gaunt was a pure-blood wizard and a member of the House of Gaunt. He was a Slytherin student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry from 1885 into the 1890s. Despite being born into a family of dark wizards, he developed a deep distrust towards the Dark Arts, and often found himself in conflicts with his friend Sebastian Sallow over how they should be used.
Companions.biography:
He was a descendant of Salazar Slytherin, born into the pure-blood House of Gaunt to a Mr and Mrs Gaunt, two dark wizards. He was born blind, and no spell was able to reverse it. After this, he took to using his wand, which was 'almost sentient', to navigate his way around. 

His upbringing resulted in trauma that made him pessimistic, distrusting of people, and sarcastic. He disagreed with his family's use of the Dark Arts, which aligned him with his favourite aunt, Noctua Gaunt, who herself wished to change the family's traditions and uncover more about Salazar Slytherin's legacy. Ominis was dismayed to find out that she had died in her attempt to navigate Slytherin's Scriptorium. 

When he was a child, he refused to perform the Cruciatus Curse, which his older siblings and parents often performed on Muggles 'for sport'. This resulted in his own family using the curse on him, creating a division between him and his family that never healed. When told to cast the curse again, he relented to avoid further anguish to himself, and found it difficult to forgive himself ever since.

magical-abilities-and-skills.dark arts: Dark Arts: Ominis was once forced into casting the Cruciatus Curse by his family. However unlike his family, he grew to detest the Dark Arts and opposed their practise.
magical-abilities-and-skills.parseltongue: Parseltongue: Ominis was a Parselmouth, meaning he could magically talk to snakes, an ability which resided in his family tree.
magical-abilities-and-skills.defence against the dark arts: Defence Against the Dark Arts: Despite being blind, Ominis was still capable of defending himself against the Dark Arts, managing to beat off waves of Inferi in the catacombs of Feldcroft. It is unknown exactly how he managed this, but as his wand was described to be 'sentient', his skill may have been linked to that.
magical-abilities-and-skills.love: Love: Though certainly not one of Ominis's most obvious qualities, he held a great amount of deep, brotherly care for his close friend, Sebastian Sallow, as well as fear for the dark path that he was going down. Even though he understood Sebastian to be manipulating him, he still felt a duty to try to stop his descent into darkness as the only person that he trusted. Furthermore, after the traumatic experiences of his childhood, he made a genuine and radical attempt to distance himself from his family and their culture of the Dark Arts.

Companions.name: Poppy Sweeting
Companions.description: Poppy Sweeting was a witch who attended Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry during the late 19th century.
Companions.biography:
Her parents were poachers and grew up in poacher camps. At some point, she became estranged from her parents and lived with her grandmother who she lived with when not at school. 

She attended Hogwarts and was was sorted into Hufflepuff house. By the 1890–1891 school year, she was a fifth-year and attended classes such as Potions with other fifth-years such as Amit Thakkar, Garreth Weasley, Samantha Dale, and the new fifth-year.

magical-abilities-and-skills.magical-beasts: Poppy had a kind heart and loved all manner of magical beasts. She had extensive knowledge of creatures and was averse to poachers and their associates.

Professors.name: Eleazar Fig
Professors.description: A wizard who teaches Magic Theory at Hogwarts. An essential character throughout your journey as he investigates the mystery of Ranrok's rebellion.
Professors.biography:
Born into a family of unknown wizarding descent in or before the 19th century, in his youth, Eleazar attended Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he was Sorted into Gryffindor House. 

At some point in his life, he met a witch named Miriam whom he eventually married, and ultimately abandoned his ambition of pursuing a career at the British Ministry of Magic in favour of accompanying her on her many travels around the world, and partook in the research that she did into what appeared to be the disappearance of ancient magic. At some point, he and Miriam eventually also met the Ministry official George Osric, whom the couple was known to have been friendly for multiple decades. 

Having eventually grown weary of his wife's quest and ended up settling into a comfortable teaching career whilst she continued her work on her own, Eleazar eventually took the job of Magical Theory professor at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he proceeded to become known to be an accomplished yet enigmatic figure. When Miriam was killed during her travels, however, he was guilt-ridden and felt responsible because he was not there to save her, and resolved to both uncover how and why she died, as well as finishing her work.

magical-abilities-and-skills.charms: Charms: Fig used the Mending Charm to repair a broken bridge.
magical-abilities-and-skills.magical theory: Magical Theory: Fig taught the subject at Hogwarts, showing his knowledge of the theory of magic.
magical-abilities-and-skills.transfiguration: Transfiguration: Fig transfigured the robes of a Hogwarts student to resemble those belonging to Phineas Nigellus Black.
magical-abilities-and-skills.dueling: Duelling: Fig showed himself to be proficient in martial magic, being able to swiftly defeat multiple animated statues in defence of his charge during the skirmish within Vault 12.
magical-abilities-and-skills.wandless-magic: Wandless magic: Fig was able to use the Summoning Charm to retrieve a Portkey without using his wand.
magical-abilities-and-skills.magizoology: Magizoology: Fig was familiar with the traits of at least some magical beasts, as shown when he recognised that a dragon attacking a carriage mid-air was abnormal behaviour.

Professors.name: Matlida Weasley
Professors.description: A witch who teaches Transfiguration at Hogwarts and eventually becomes the Deputy Headmistress. She will eventually lead you to the Room of Requirement, a crucial aspect of the game.
Professors.biography:
Matilda was born into the wizarding Weasley family and attended Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where she was sorted into Gryffindor House. Noted to have been an 'exceptionally talented witch', she was presumably a gifted pupil. 
In her second year, she met and befriended Deek, an old house-elf employed in the school's kitchens, and together, they discovered the Room of Requirement. She would visit the room many more times throughout her schooling, at one point forgetting her school bag there, which she recovered only while showing the room to a new student during the 1890–1891 school year, much to her delight. 

After graduating, Matilda joined the British Ministry of Magic as a Curse-Breaker. Her calming presence and extraordinary wandwork allowed her to rise quickly through the ranks. Around this time, Matilda also befriended Chiyo Kogawa, a Mahoutokoro-educated witch of the Japanese Ministry of Magic, whom she stayed in touch with over the years that followed. 

At some point during her Ministry career, Matilda met and fell in love with a Curse-Breaker named Paul, who reciprocated her feelings, and before long, Matilda had resigned her position at the Ministry in favour of travelling the world with him as freelance Curse-Breakers. With time, however, Matilda began to miss her family, the stability of a settled life, and the camaraderie of working with a talented group of witches and wizards. As Paul had no desire to 'stop moving', their romance ended, and Matilda settled back down in Britain by herself. 
At some point, she worked with Chiyo Kogawa in Yokohama, a time described as 'eventful'. 

At some point before the 1890s, Matilda became the professor of Transfiguration at Hogwarts, and proved herself to be a stern yet fair-minded instructor regarded for her ability to combine a good sense of humour with an air of authority. She was also eventually promoted to the position of Deputy Headmistress, in which capacity her students found her to be 'lightly intimidating'. 

At the start of the 1890–1891 school year, a new student with the power to see and control ancient magic was enrolled at the school to start as a fifth-year, as they had acquired their magical powers later in life. Around the time the acceptance letter was dispatched to the student, a strange magical disturbance took place at the school that greatly concerned the student body. Professor Weasley joined Professor Hecat in Classroom 3C to address the students, where she admitted that the staff had no knowledge of what had caused the disturbance to happen.

magical-abilities-and-skills.transfiguration: As a Professor of Transfiguration at Hogwarts, Professor Weasley was accomplished in this branch of magic.
magical-abilities-and-skills.defence against the dark arts: As a former Curse-Breaker, she was proficient in this field of magic, especially on the subject of counter-curses.

Professors.name: Phineas Nigellus Black
Professors.description: The Headmaster at Hogwarts. An unpopular figure among his peers due to his disinterest in the position, even canceling Quidditch for the entire school year.
Professors.biography:
Phineas Nigellus was born to the House of Black in 1847 He had three siblings; Sirius, Elladora, and Iola Black. 
The siblings were raised in a household that strongly believed in the importance of blood purity, and as such Phineas carried a grudge against Muggle-borns, whom he called 'Mudbloods' and considered 'simple'. At the age of eleven, circa 1858, Phineas Nigellus began his schooling at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he was Sorted into Slytherin House. 
Some time after leaving school circa 1865, Phineas Nigellus married Ursula Flint, and at the age of 30, the two had a son, Sirius, named after his deceased brother. Four more children followed: Phineas, who did not inherit his father's views on pure-blood supremacy and was disowned by the family for supporting Muggle rights; Cygnus, Belvina, and Arcturus. 

As an adult, Black became a professor at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, a job which he loathed due to the impertinence of his students. He was later appointed as the Headmaster of Hogwarts by the British Ministry of Magic, accepting the position only for the prestige associated with it, and showing very little interest in acting as a role model or in children's education. In his role, he attempted to persuade Minister Faris Spavin to change the Hogwarts admissions process, very likely to favour pure-bloods and restrict Muggle-borns, though his request was declined. While he was Headmaster, his two sons Sirius and Phineas both attended Hogwarts.

magical-abilities-and-skills.charms: Charms: Black was adept at casting the Freezing Spell, and did so on at least one occassion to extinquish a fire caused by three Slytherin students.

Professors.name: Aesop Sharp
Professors.description: A Potions Master at Hogwarts. A stern and straightforward professor, Sharp became known for his challenging classes and lack of patience with students who didn't want to learn. However, he received immense satisfaction for students that go the extra mile.
Professors.biography:
Aesop was born into a family of unknown wizarding descent in or before the 19th century. He attended Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he was sorted into Slytherin House. 

After leaving Hogwarts, Aesop joined the British Ministry of Magic and landed a position in the Auror Office. On 31 December 1875, Aesop was issued a memorandum from the office about Borgin and Burkes's suspicious activities and the decision for Aesop to join the Aurors who were watching the shop. 
At some point in his career, he and his partner were working an assignment when they were ambushed, resulting in a severe injury to him and death to his partner. When it became clear that this meant he would be relegated to a desk and tedious paperwork for the rest of his career, Aesop decided to retire from the Office, and felt his time would be better spent passing on what he knew to the next generation of young witches and wizards at his old school. Part of the motivation to apply to the job of Potions Master at Hogwarts was to use the resources there to cure his injuries. 

His wish of sharing his extensive experience involving battleworthy draughts and elixirs with the students came to fruition when he was offered the job of Potions Master at the school, at which point he would henceforth come to be known to students as 'Professor Sharp', and was granted a classroom down in the dungeons to teach in. In time, he became widely known for his challenging lessons and lack of patience with misbehaving students, but also for his genuine pride in those who exceeded in the class.

magical-abilities-and-skills.auror: Auror skills: Being a former Auror, Sharp would have been well-trained in defensive magic and the other necessary skills for the job.
magical-abilities-and-skills.potions: Potions: Being a Potions Master, Sharp was an expert with potions, with a particular interest in 'battleworthy' elixirs.
magical-abilities-and-skills.charms: Charms: Sharp was capable of teaching both the Banishing Charm and the Severing Charm to his students.

Professors.name: Dinah Hecat
Professors.description: A witch who taught Defence Against the Dark Arts. An authoritative and likable professor, her classes were demanding as her teaching methods were hands-on.
Professors.biography:
Dinah Hecat was born into a family of unknown wizarding descent around 1847 and received her magical education at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry where she was Sorted into Ravenclaw House on the eve of her arrival, and proved to be an academically gifted student, as she excelled in her studies and completed her schooling at the top of her class. 
In her seventh year, she was named Head Girl, though she later remarked that the students got into just as much mischief in her day as they did in later years, and that she had 'looked the other way at all sort of roguery' during this time. One notable exception to this, however, was when she reprimanded a Slytherin student, and future Headmaster, Phineas Nigellus Black, for having eaten a Sugar Quill in the middle of a lecture. 

Sometime after her graduation from Hogwarts, Dinah joined the British Ministry of Magic, and became an Unspeakable at the Department of Mysteries. During her career she was ultimately 'wounded by time itself' finding that her body had aged considerably as a result. Accepting the incident as an occupational hazard of her position, however, she would go on to carry the burden remarkably well later in life, and noted to her students that if anything, her former career at the Ministry had taught her the value of simplicity, especially in the heat of battle. 

After her time at the ministry she returned to Hogwarts as the Defence Against the Dark Arts professor, where she was granted Classroom 3C and an office to work in. In this role, she was a highly efficient educator who took her duties very seriously, and whose hands-on approach to teaching were believed to have satiated an innate desire for action. During her teaching career, the skeleton of a Hebridean Black hung from the ceiling of her classroom; the trophy from the Great Poacher Raid of 1878, in which she single-handedly took out the largest poaching ring in eastern Wales.

magical-abilities-and-skills.defence against the dark arts: Defence Against the Dark Arts: As the Professor of Defence Against the Dark Arts at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, she would have presumably been well-versed in defensive magic.
magical-abilities-and-skills.magical knowledge: Magical knowledge: Due to her past employment in the Department of Mysteries, Hecat came to amass certain important information from the various research there, such as the repercussions of tampering with time-magic.

Professors.name: Mirabel Garlick
Professors.description: The Herbology Professor at Hogwarts. A kind, thoughtful, and caring professor who has an affinity for magical plants.
Professors.biography:
Garlick was born in London and grew up in a household full of Muggles. She did not feel at home until she was a student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry where she was sorted into Hufflepuff house. It was at Hogwarts that she finally 'blossomed' and discovered her extraordinary affinity for magical plants. During her first year she met the seventh-year Sirona Ryan, forming a life long friendship. In her seventh year, she was awarded the Hogwarts Herbology Award in recognition of her exemplary skill in the field of Herbology. 

At some point, she became the Professor of Herbology at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Her sunny demeanour and flowery language charmed colleagues and students alike, prompting some students to worry she might one day leave them for another greenhouse. 

During the 1890–1891 school year, she had high hopes for Hufflepuff's chances at Quidditch, although she had not yet learned the rules. Regardless, Headmaster Phineas Nigellus Black had cancelled Quidditch for the year due to an injury during last spring's final.

magical-abilities-and-skills.herbology: Herbology: As a Professor of Herbology at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, she would have been an accomplished Herbologist. In her seventh year at Hogwarts, she was awarded the Hogwarts Herbology Award for her talent in the field.
magical-abilities-and-skills.charms: Charms: As a teacher of Herbology, Mirabel demonstrated superb ability in performing spells such as Water-Making Spell, used to give plants water and to speed up their growth, and the Summoning Charm. She could also use the Mending Charm to instantly repair the attic glass of the school greenhouse during a Mandrake class. She also offered to teach the Levitation Charm to her new student in exchange for an assignment.

Professors.name: Abraham Ronen
Professors.description: A Charms Master Professor at Hogwarts. An easygoing and enthusiastic professor, he created the Summoning Court to allow students to practice the Summoning Charm. He considers his relationships with students and activities to be equally as important as class itself.
Professors.biography:
Before or in the 19th century, Abraham Ronen was born into a family of unknown wizarding descent. He had a rather austere father that tutored him at home. As a result of this and his time at Hogwarts, he developed a love of games of all forms, particularly Gobstones. In his youth, Abraham attended Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he was Sorted into Slytherin House. He allegedly met his wife during a lively Gobstones tournament. 

By 1883, he became the school's Charms Master and was granted Classroom 2E on the third-floor and an office in which to work. To the delight of most of his students, his unorthodox teaching style often incorporated gameplay, including the creation of a Summoner's Court area for student to practise the Summoning Charm. He still held the position during the 1890–1891 school year, which saw the arrival of a new student who drew unusual attention to themself by beginning their attendance at the school as a fifth-year, something that was highly irregular. That year, Professor Ronen also held remedial classes for said student as part of a special curriculum designed to help them catch up to the educational level of their other classmates.

magical-abilities-and-skills.charms: Charms: As an old Professor of Charms at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, he would have been accomplished with charms.

Professors.name: Bai Howin
Professors.description: Teaches Beasts Class at Hogwarts. During her class, you'll encounter a few tamed Beasts that you can interact with.
Professors.biography:
An encounter in her youth with an Occamy left her in awe of beasts, making her loathe poachers for use of Galleons. 

 In 1890, Bai introduced a new student to their first ever Beasts class. At the start of the lesson, she warned of the dangers a creature could pose if her students did not take proper care it. Her lesson was a review in the basics of how to care for a beast with each student getting a Puffskein. When one put its long tongue in Poppy Sweeting's face, she told her to pay attention for 'the tongue of a Puffskein can be a slippery devil'. Toward the end of the lesson, she asked Poppy to take the new student to the Kneazle pen. 

When the lesson was over, she spoke to her new student and asked if they enjoyed the lesson. She saw the student with Poppy protecting a Kneazle when two students tried to rip her whiskers off. Bai was grateful but asked that they leave it to her in the future. She thought the students were nearly as bad as Victor Rookwood's Poacher Pack. She considered the deaths of creatures to be a waste of resources. 

Matilda Weasley asked her to give the student a few assignments so they could catch up with their year group. Outside of lessons, she also encouraged the student to study beasts.

magical-abilities-and-skills.magizoology: Magizoology: Professor Howin taught the subject of Beasts at Hogwarts, showing she was an experienced Magizoologist with a thorough understanding of magical beasts and how to handle them.
magical-abilities-and-skills.charms: Charms: Professor Howin could produce a corporeal Patronus in the form of a dragon.

Professors.name: Chiyo Kogawa
Professors.description: Teaches Broom Flight Class. A strict teacher who follows the rules to a tee due to the nature of the class, this is where you'll learn how to fly for the first time.
Professors.biography:
She attended school at Mahoutokoro. She and her best friend Asuka trained together to try-out for the Toyohashi Tengu. However, she did not realise her friend was very nervous that they'd both fail which caused a bad experience in her try-outs for the Tengu, an event that taught her a lesson about honour and trust, traits she valued immensely. Her try-outs went amazingly after she unknowingly drank Felix Felicis in her tea, made by her friend Asuka, who was anxious about not making the team. After finding this out, she decided to withdraw from the try-outs without revealing Asuka had cheated as well. She was training to be a Keeper. 

Chiyo eventually worked for the Japanese Ministry of Magic. At one point before her tenure at Hogwarts, she worked with Matilda Weasley in Yokohama, a time described as 'eventful'. Matilda recruited her to work at Hogwarts where she taught Flying class. 

During the 1890–1891 school year, she gave a refresher class to fifth-years which included a new student. She implied that Everett Clopton in particular needed to relearn how to fly on a broomstick safely. She later gave the new student two tasks to improve their flying skills and help them learn new spells. The first was to pop balloons she had placed around Hogsmeade station and the Hogwarts Quidditch pitch, after which she taught them the Freezing Spell. The second was to try flying near Keenbridge Tower along the water south of Hogwarts, and then around the Spires in the southwest, after which she taught them the Slowing Charm.

magical-abilities-and-skills.flight: Flight: As a Flying Instructor at Hogwarts, she was accomplished with flying a broomstick and teaching others how to do so safely.
magical-abilities-and-skills.charms: Charms: She was capable of casting the Freezing Spell successfully.

Professors.name: Mudiwa Onai
Professors.description: The mother of one of your companions, Natsai Onai, Mudiwa teaches Divination at Hogwarts.
Professors.biography: She once taught Divination at Uagadou. She was a gifted Seer whose faith was shaken by the fact that she did not foresee the death of her husband. Deciding to leave those painful memories behind, she accepted an invitation by Professor Weasley to teach Divination at Hogwarts. She was an Animagus, haven taken the form of an African fish eagle, but refused to transform after her husband was murdered. She had sent her daughter, Natsai Onai, to Uagadou, but after becoming the Professor of Divination at Hogwarts, she transferred Natsai there so that the two could be together. She preferred to conjure magic with her bare hands.

magical-abilities-and-skills.divination: Divination: She was a natural born Seer. She also taught Divination at Uagadou and Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, indicating she was well-learned in this field.
magical-abilities-and-skills.transfiguration: Transfiguration: She was an Animagus and took the form of an African fish eagle, but largely refrained after her husband was killed.
magical-abilities-and-skills.wandless-magic: Wandless magic: She could conjure magic with her bare hands.

Professors.name: Gladwin Moon
Professors.description: A caretaker at Hogwarts. He will eventually teach you Alohamora, a spell that allows you to unlock locks.
Professors.biography: When he was a child in Korea, he suffered a trauma due to a Demiguise and developed a secret fear of them. Gladwin attended Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry where he was a quite popular and interesting student. However, he was not successful after he left the school and returned to be the Hogwarts caretaker, a role he looked down upon. He became caretaker some time after 1876, after his predecessor, Rancorous Carpe, resigned for 'health reasons'.

Professors.name: Satyavati Shah
Professors.description: Professor Satyavati Shah was the professor of Astronomy at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry in the late 19th century. Professor Shah had a sister named Suchrita who also studied Astronomy and had contact at Cambridge University. They seemingly had a close relationship, taking at least one trip together to Jantar Mantar in late 1890
Professors.biography:
After being raised largely in the Muggle world, Satyavati Shah took an interest in the sciences, which she carried with her into her schooling at Hogwarts. She also had a sister named Suchrita. In her youth, she began attending Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry where she was Sorted into Ravenclaw house. 

After graduating, she eventually took up a position as professor of Astronomy and devoted herself to her subject in a way that most would find monastic and extreme. Like her scientific subject, she could come off to her pupils as a bit cold and demanding. She was easily carried away when talking about the heavens and viewed many of the other Hogwarts disciplines (like Divination) as wishy-washy. 

Professor Shah's sister Suchrita, with whom she kept a correspondence through letters, had a similar interest in Astronomy. In 1890, Satyavati and Suchrita were planning to take a trip later in the year to the site of Jantar Mantar, New Delhi, a place that consisted of 13 architectural astronomy instruments. Suchrita mentioned in one letter to Satyavati and expressed joy in getting to go on such an adventure with her sister. In the same letter, Suchrita also disclosed to Satyavati regarding Satyavati and Suchrita's theory that her Cambridge contacts had been wrong in their understanding of meteor showers, and told her that Muggle astronomers had developed a way to calculate the position of dust at Earth's orbit in order to link meteors to comets.

magical-abilities-and-skills.astronomy: Astronomy: Shah was a professor of Astronomy at Hogwarts, showing she was a learned Astronomer.
